thread.title: have the starting floor be locked by default

comments.text: 70% of the time when i go to a new player's area to help teach them, they have accidentally fucked up or deleted their floor. this can be very discouraging to new players when
just one wrong move in a game they dont understand can ruin their experience entirely if nobody is there to help them fix it.
true! i guess this needs to be balanced against the benefit of being able to understand how one can click "edit" on lasered objects (something useful to learn) and then being ...
... able to, say, stretch out their arms to increase the ground for more comfortabe building. maybe there's an approach that combines the best of both worlds?
like a special security that somehow disallows far-away movement for the ground only on day 1? do you know what the most common ways of messing it up are for newcomers?
i've seen a few oversized grounds and way too many moved grounds. maybe just lock it? not sure.
...oh yeah, right, that was the original idea. oop
oversized as in, too high, right?
Maybe if we were to lock down just height-scaling + far away moving for that ground, we might get rid of most issues, while keeping the benefits of intentional edit tries on it.
as long as locks keep preventing editing, haha. maybe a lock that you can pick what can't be done?
(guess we'd also need to lock down deleting, say for new users, at least if there's no other big object around below.)
ooh, yes! now that i thinjk of it though, i wonder how the new wall security will work with the oversized issue? i'll do some quick tests.
thanks. by the way, if one is in change things mode, the new wall guard is not active.
done. you can see now of course, but won't be teleported to the surface. hmm.
right. it will only bump back (if in non-change things mode) if a previous teleport point exists, so in this case, none on top of the ground exists.
i guessed that, as i've been testing it since i came on.
